com.netflix.governator.guice

Interface LifecycleInjectorBuilder

  • All Known Implementing Classes:
    DelegatingLifecycleInjectorBuilder, LifecycleInjectorBuilderImpl

    public interface LifecycleInjectorBuilder
    Builder for a LifecycleInjector

    • Method Summary

      Methods 
      Modifier and Type Method and Description
      LifecycleInjector build()
      Build and return the injector
      Injector createInjector()
      Deprecated. 
      this API creates the "main" child injector. but it has the side effect of calling build() method that will create a new LifecycleInjector. Instead, you should just build() LifecycleInjector object. then call LifecycleInjector.createInjector() directly.
      LifecycleInjectorBuilder ignoringAllAutoBindClasses()
      Do not bind ANY AutoBindSingleton classes
      LifecycleInjectorBuilder ignoringAutoBindClasses(java.util.Collection<java.lang.Class<?>> ignoreClasses)
      Specify specific AutoBindSingleton classes that should NOT be bound in the main binding phase

      Set the Guice stage - the default is Production

      • withModules

        LifecycleInjectorBuilder withModules(Module... modules)
        Specify standard Guice modules for the main binding phase. Note that any modules provided in a previous call to withModules will be discarded. To add to the list of modules call withAdditionalModules(java.lang.Iterable<? extends Module>)

      • withRootModule

        @Deprecated
LifecycleInjectorBuilder withRootModule(java.lang.Class<?> mainModule)
        Deprecated. 
        Specify a root application module class from which a set of additional modules may be derived using module dependencies. Module dependencies are specified using @Inject on the module constructor and indicating the dependent modules as constructor arguments.
        Parameters:
        mainModule - root application module
        Returns:
        this

      • withModuleClasses

        LifecycleInjectorBuilder withModuleClasses(java.lang.Iterable<java.lang.Class<? extends Module>> modules)
        Specify a set of module classes from which a set of additional modules may be derived using module dependencies. Module dependencies are specified using @Inject on the module constructor and indicating the dependent modules as constructor arguments. Note that any existing modules that were added will be removed by this call
        Parameters:
        modules - root application modules
        Returns:
        this

      • usingClasspathScanner

        LifecycleInjectorBuilder usingClasspathScanner(ClasspathScanner scanner)
        Normally, the classpath scanner is allocated internally. This method allows for a custom scanner to be used. NOTE: Any packages specifies via usingBasePackages(String...) will be ignored if this method is called.
        Parameters:
        scanner - the scanner to use
        Returns:
        this

      • withModuleTransformer

        LifecycleInjectorBuilder withModuleTransformer(ModuleTransformer transformer)
        Just before creating the injector all the modules will run through the transformer. Transformers will be executed in the order in which withModuleTransformer is called. Note that once the first filter is called subsequent calls will only be given the previous set of filtered modules.
        Parameters:
        transformer -
        Returns:
        this

      • withModuleTransformer

        LifecycleInjectorBuilder withModuleTransformer(java.util.Collection<? extends ModuleTransformer> transformer)
        Just before creating the injector all the modules will run through the filter. Transformers will be executed in the order in which withModuleTransformer is called. Note that once the first filter is called subsequent calls will only be given the previous set of filtered modules.
        Parameters:
        transformer -
        Returns:
        this

      • withModuleTransformer

        LifecycleInjectorBuilder withModuleTransformer(ModuleTransformer... transformer)
        Just before creating the injector all the modules will run through the filter. Transformers will be executed in the order in which withModuleTransformer is called. Note that once the first filter is called subsequent calls will only be given the previous set of filtered modules.
        Parameters:
        transformer -
        Returns:

      • build

        LifecycleInjector build()
        Build and return the injector
        Returns:
        LifecycleInjector

      • createInjector

        @Deprecated
Injector createInjector()
        Deprecated. this API creates the "main" child injector. but it has the side effect of calling build() method that will create a new LifecycleInjector. Instead, you should just build() LifecycleInjector object. then call LifecycleInjector.createInjector() directly.
        Internally build the LifecycleInjector and then return the result of calling LifecycleInjector.createInjector()
        Returns:
        Guice injector
